sub_title: Consultant at Nexus Domini IT BV
summary:
Since the beginning of my career I have worked in a lot of different level IT Networking related positions. Starting as a 2nd line Network Engineer I quickly moved up into a senior / all round position and later even a specialist role. Currently I am working as Network Consultant / Architect, responsible for design, implementation and troubleshooting of large scale networks. 

Main area’s of expertise :
Routing and Switching
Brands: Cisco and Juniper
Technologies: STP, (MC-)LACP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, L3 VPN, VPLS, QinQ, QOS, IPv4 and IPv6

Application delivery
Brands: Radware/Alteon and F5
Technologies: (Global) Loadbalaning, Load balancer virtualization

Security 
Brands: Fortinet, Juniper, Cisco, Checkpoint, RSA and Tippingpoint
Technologies: Access control, Authentication (2 factor), VPN, Firewall virtualization, Firewall Management, Disaster recovery, Firewall service based traffic flow design

Advanced trouble shooting
For example: Raw traffic analyses with Wireshark or TCPdump

Also experience with:
Operating systems:
Brands: Windows Server 2000 and 2003 
Technologies: Active directory, performance

Security:
Palo Alto

Virtualisation
Brands: VMWare ESX and Vsphere, Zerto
Technologies: Conversions (V2P, P2V), storage, networking and disaster recovery

Other IT related services and procedures:
DNS, DHCP, SNMP, NTP, ITIL

Specialties: Routing and Switching
SpanningTree, (MC-)LACP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, L3 VPN, VPLS, QinQ, QOS, IPv4 and IPv6

Application delivery
(Global) Loadbalaning, Load balancer virtualization

Security 
Access control, Authentication (2 factor), VPN, Firewall virtualization, Firewall Management, Disaster recovery, Firewall service based traffic flow design

Advanced trouble shooting
Raw traffic analyses with Wireshark or TCPdump

school.name: Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
I have started Nexus Domini IT together with Erik Vanaubel. 
We have been successfully providing our services to various national and international clients over the past 7 years now!
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Principal Consultant I am responsible for creating the High and Low Level Designs. The initial project was the “KPN Op Een Netwerk” KOEN redesign. The setup was suffering from data center failover problems, causing traffic loss and require manual intervention to recover from a failure. The redesign of the overall connections is designed to overcome these issues. It included a simplification of the physical setup, as well as a create a uniform logical setup. Furthermore it undid administrative entanglement within the organization and allow for a clear boundary of responsibilities. This project was finalized early 2017.
 
After the initial project I was part of several KPN internal migration projects and a lifecycle renewal project of the DCI MPLS backbone. The latter entailed not only the replacement but also a merger of two KPN MPLS networks.
 
My last project (the MPLS merger project) initiated a new program called Connectivity Exchange, which had the sole purpose of providing full IP connectivity between all KPN services and customers as well as services provided by KPN acquisitions over the past few years. Overlapping IP spaces, inconsistent or incomplete administration and little to no organizational integration, meant no synergy of products and assets could be achieved. Whenever a new service was to be offered via existing KPN infrastructure to a customer, this resulted in tailored solutions with expensive leased lines and workarounds to get things working. Long implementation times and difficulties servicing them was the obvious result. The Connectivity Exchange project provided a new pre-provisioned IP backbone setup, with a specific set of regulations, rules and assurance processes to allow for quick, predictable and reliable delivery of any service to any customer. As part of a team of eight, we were responsible for the design, structure and implementation of this program over the past year.
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant (Contractor)

profile_positions.description: As a Network designer I was responsible for creating High and Low Level Designs for various projects at NXP and NXP affiliated corporations, the largest of which is a secure datacenter LAN and WAN setup in China. A FlexPod forms the compute and storage basis in this design and allows me to utilize my previously gained understanding and experiences with FlexPods in the past.
profile_positions.title: Network Designer (Subcontractor)

profile_positions.description:
As Network Architect at ASML Veldhoven I was responsible for the design and implementation of their new Integrated Compute Stack’s (ICS) based on Cisco/NetApp FlexPod as well as the new data center firewall solution. 

This job has given me a chance to broaden my horizon once again, as I had not yet had the pleasure of working with the new Cisco UCS product lines. This innovative platform has given me a different outlook on datacenter networking and service delivery and is very challenging to say the least. The addition of the new transparent virtual firewall solution from Cisco in the ICS called the Virtual Security Gateway means I was able to utilize my security and firewalling skills as well for this project. 

The new data center firewall design and implementation project that fell under my responsibility has allowed me to further deepen my knowledge on several of the current enterprise class firewall systems and management tooling. The challenges in this design has given me an even more in-depth perspective in the various possibilities for data center firewalling. 

During the last 6 months I an important role in the integration of the Cymer IT environments with ASML as well as the Data Center integration in San Diego. As with most network mergers private IP usage still remains a challenge which at least temporarily require complex NAT and global WAN strategies.
profile_positions.title: Network Architect (Subcontractor)

profile_positions.description: Delivered the High Level Design for a Cisco/NetApp FlexPod environment in the new Amsterdam datacenter and validation of the Low level desing and implementation by Dimension Data. This new environment is used to migrate and merge existing data center activities to Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Network Designer (Subcontractor)

profile_positions.description:
Still enjoying my time and working hard at GDC!

As the design work on the MPLS network is now as good as finished  and implementation is well under way. (All ASR systems are in place, and we are waiting on the connections between some of the locations to be delivered) to finish it completely. It is now time to shift our focus to the services on the Network 2.0.

Currently I am working closely with Patrick Lammers on the Firewall (virtualization) and management of the new DCLAN services design. Site redundancy and automatic failovers are some of the more challenging but fun parts of this design and both are well accommodated by the MPLS design using MP-BGP and OSPF redistribution solutions. The high-bandwidth demands, flexibility in management and need for virtualization and resource allocation for customers are our main focus right now. All in All, still a good challenge but even more so a lot of fun!

On a side track, I am supporting Erik Vanaubel since he has now taken on both the Load balancing design and extension of the MPLS network with ME switches, changing the BGP design to now include route reflectors for local ME rings and support MPLS to the access-layer solutions to create maximum flexibility for all customers and services available on the network without creating any new restrictions.

It is nice to see our previous design at work and accommodating every need we have encountered so far in any of these designs and customer requests without limitations.
profile_positions.title: Contractor

profile_positions.description: As a Consultant I was placed out as a subcontractor at large financial and telecom clients in the Netherlands. Furthermore I worked on short term network projects in the Benelux area. (See other positions over the period of January 2010 until August 2011)
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Erik Vanaubel and I have designed, supervised and supported the migration for LU and Kraft food in Herentals. They wanted help to migrate their core network to new equipment, incorporate QoS for VoIP, review their security policies and set up a new template for their access-switches. 

All systems have been migrated successfully and their new Core is operational. The Access-switches are now being implemented by the use of the new template by Lu employees.
profile_positions.title: Contractor

profile_positions.description: As part of the internal firewall team, I have been rewriting security policy standards for ING services. I have worked closely together with Arnoud Post and have over the course of 3 months tried to standardize and certify the internal security policies that dictated and limit internal and external traffic flows on the ING managed firewalls.
profile_positions.title: Contractor at IFM
